An owb who comes into contact and is chosen by one of the Forsaken gains a fragment of that demigod's power and forges a permanent connection with it. This act transforms the owb into a larger, more powerful creature and imbues it with the power of divine transference, allowing the owb to gain followers and grant spells to them. These are owb prophets. Owb prophets may have some portion of the Forsaken's power, but they use their authority to gain more sway over calignis and other worshippers. [Owb Prophet](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1258) **Source** [Bestiary 3](/Sources.aspx?ID=66) pg. 197 **Perception** +24; [greater darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12) **Languages** [Aklo](/Languages.aspx?ID=13), [Caligni](/Languages.aspx?ID=28), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Undercommon](/Languages.aspx?ID=11); (can't speak any languages); [telepathy](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=37) 100 feet **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +25, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +26, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) +24, [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11) +23, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) +25, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +25 **Str** +8 **Dex** +6 **Con** +8 **Int** +4 **Wis** +5 **Cha** +7 **Forsaken Patron** Each owb prophet serves as a conduit to one of the shadowy demigods known as the Forsaken. Forsaken patrons are detailed in the sidebar, and each grants the owb prophet additional abilities.
**[Light Blindness](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=22)** --- **AC** 34 **Fort** +25 **Ref** +23 **Will** +24 Resistances mental 10 **HP** 225 --- **Speed** 5 feet, fly 40 feet **Melee** claw +27 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)), **Damage** 2d8+11 slashing plus 2d8 cold **Ranged** burning cold +25 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [range 120 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)), **Damage** 4d8 cold plus 2d8 [persistent cold](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) and clutching cold **Occult Innate Spells** DC 33, attack +25 - **Cantrips (7th)** [Chill Touch](/Spells.aspx?ID=35), [Daze](/Spells.aspx?ID=61), [Read Aura](/Spells.aspx?ID=246), [Shield](/Spells.aspx?ID=280) - **3rd** [Mind Reading](/Spells.aspx?ID=194) (at will) - **4th** [Invisibility](/Spells.aspx?ID=164) - **5th** [Shadow Walk](/Spells.aspx?ID=275) (×3; see shadow's swiftness) - **6th** [Darkness](/Spells.aspx?ID=59) (at will), [Dominate](/Spells.aspx?ID=87) (×3) - **7th** [Plane Shift](/Spells.aspx?ID=222) (to or from the [Shadow Plane](/Planes.aspx?ID=11) only; ×3), [Shadow Blast](/Spells.aspx?ID=273) (×3) **Burning Cold Fusillade** The owb prophet makes three burning cold Strikes. **Clutching Cold** A creature hit by the prophet's burning cold Strike becomes [immobilized](/Conditions.aspx?ID=24) in a cluster of binding ice crystals (Escape DC 31). **Curse of Darkness** ([Curse](/Traits.aspx?ID=38), [Darkness](/Traits.aspx?ID=39), [Evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120)) The owb inflicts a curse on one creature taking [persistent cold damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) from their burning cold Strike, stealing the victim's vibrancy. The creature must attempt a DC 32Fortitude save. On a failure, the creature gains [light blindness](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=22) and its coloration turns to washed out shades of gray, along with all equipment it carries, wields, or wears. These effects have an unlimited duration. Regardless of the result of its save, the creature is temporarily immune for 1 minute. If the owb uses this ability on a [caligni](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=18), the curse can't be removed short of [_wish_](/Spells.aspx?ID=377) or similar powerful magic. **Shadow's Swiftness** An owb prophet can Cast [_shadow walk_](/Spells.aspx?ID=275) as a 3-action activity instead of 1 minute. If they do so, they target only themself.
Forsaken Patrons Each owb prophet gains its power through a connection with a Forsaken patron. The patron grants the owb additional spells and has its own religious symbol and favored weapons. Each entry notes any ability or occult innate spell the Forsaken grants to its prophets, plus its favored weapon. **Enkaar, the Malformed Prisoner**: This mutilated horror is the Forsaken patron of fetters, lethargy, and physical corruption. **Spell** [_phantom pain_](/Spells.aspx?ID=220) (4th, at will); **Favored Weapon** [spiked chain](/Weapons.aspx?ID=60) **Eyes That Watch**: This strange trio of feline eyes is the Forsaken patron of inferiority, cats, and strangers. **Ability** [lifesense](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=21) 120 feet; **Favored Weapon** [dagger](/Weapons.aspx?ID=3) **Grasping Iovett**: A beautiful form of indescribable variety, Iovett is the Forsaken patron of accidents, parasites, and reckless lust. **Spell** [_charm_](/Spells.aspx?ID=34) (4th, at will); **Favored Weapon** [shortsword](/Weapons.aspx?ID=43) **Husk**: This androgynous creature is the Forsaken patron of emptiness, loneliness, and narcissism. **Spell** [_silence_](/Spells.aspx?ID=287) (4th, at will); **Favored Weapon** [shortsword](/Weapons.aspx?ID=43) **Lady Razor**: This stern magistrate forbids showing kindness or mercy to family members. Lady Razor is the Forsaken patron of family strife, suspicion, and vengeance. **Spell** [_weapon storm_](/Spells.aspx?ID=373) (4th, at will); **Favored Weapon** [dagger](/Weapons.aspx?ID=3) **Reshmit of the Heavy Voice**: Taking the form of a massive shadow, Reshmit is the Forsaken patron of broken things, forgetting, and unexpected violence. **Spell** [_modify memory_](/Spells.aspx?ID=200) (4th, at will); **Favored Weapon** [morningstar](/Weapons.aspx?ID=8) **Thalaphyrr Martyr-Minder**: The Forsaken patron of failed heroics, imprisonment, and squandered time. **Spell** [_slow_](/Spells.aspx?ID=289) (4th, at will); **Favored Weapon** [spear](/Weapons.aspx?ID=10)
